The claim was made by Gov: Jerry Brown during his State of the State address in 2016.
The claim states that: two million new jobs have been created" in California since 2011.
The claim is a significant part of Gov: Brown's emphasis on the "California comeback" during his second stint as governor.
The claim was fact: checked using data on nonfarm payroll jobs, which showed a growth of just over two million jobs between January 2011 and December 2015.
